Gyeonggang Line Rob Davidson November 11, 2016 1 The Gyeonggang Line 1.1 Introduction The Gyeonggang Line runs from Pangyo station to Yeoju station. It is approximately 55 km in length. It is operated by Korail. 1.2 Line Map Figure 1.1: Gyeonggang Line Stations 1.3 Data Attribution Seoul subway data provided by Seoul City Traffic and Transportation Policy Division through the Seoul Open Data Plaza.
2 Passenger Arrival and Departure Heatmaps 2.1 Morning Arrival Heatmap 2.2 Evening Departure Heatmap

2 Passenger Arrival and Departure Heatmaps We can use heatmaps to interactively explore passenger morning arrival and evening departure times. 2.1 Morning Arrival Heatmap The passenger arrival heatmap shows that, not unsurprisingly, the termini have the most morning arrivals. Figure 2.1: Arrival Heatmap 2.2 Evening Departure Heatmap The passenger departure heatmap shows that, not unsurprisingly, the termini have the most evening departures. Figure 2.2: Departure Heatmap
3 Using Data to Augment Gyeonggang Line Map 3.1 Augmented Gyeonggang Line Map

3 Using Data to Augment Gyeonggang Line Map We saw the map of the Gyeonggang Line in Section 1.2. We can now augment it with additional information. 3.1 Augmented Gyeonggang Line Map The map will now include additional information about each station and the size of its marker represent the total number of passengers that arrive at the station. Figure 3.1: Augmented Map
